item.title: Georgia Tech Acceptance!
item.description: I just wanted to share with you guys the amazing news that I got into one of the best Computer Science schools in the world!

item.title: Microsoft SWE Interview Process
item.description: This post details my experiences during the interview process for a Software Engineering position in Microsoft’s Azure Storage team.

item.title: Automatic Carousel
item.description: One of the features someone wanted me to implement for their website was an automatic carousel for their site. This article explains some ways on how to implement one.

item.title: DailyChallenges 1 & 2
item.description: There is this website, Daily Coding Problem, that emails you Daily Challenges asked by major tech companies that you can complete for practice. Many people use it for coding interviews, but I’m aiming to use it to stop from getting rusty while I figure out what project I want to do next. Enjoy my thought processes!

item.title: Reasons For Sabbatical
item.description: A post mentioning the numerous reasons for not having updated my blog in the last several months.

item.title: Creating a Minecraft Server on Azure Cloud
item.description: This post explains how I created a Minecraft server using Azure cloud because I could not find any working template for such a case.

item.title: Weather App
item.description: I took up an interview challenge from DegreeWorks and created a bare-bones web app that pulls data from OpenWeatherMap.

item.title: Quick Update
item.description: Just wanted to let you guys know that , while I have been very busy with schoolwork and work over the past several weeks, I am still finding time to have some fun.

item.title: Daily Challenges
item.description: There is a subreddit, r/dailyprogrammer, that has weekly challenges of various difficulties that I will solve and discuss in posts from time to time.

item.title: Bandit Part 3
item.description: Part 3 of my Bandit write-up, starting at level 16.

item.title: Hack The Box Registration
item.description: Registering for this was a lot harder than I thought…

item.title: Bandit Part 2
item.description: Part 2 of me solving the wargame Bandit.

item.title: Bandit Part 1
item.description: My attempt at solving all 34 levels of the wargame Bandit.

item.title: Cloud Security Report
item.description: My team members and I researched a report about securing data in the cloud.

item.title: Hello World
item.description: My name is Colin Lightfoot and I am a software developer and an aspiring pentester. This blog is mainly going to contain news regarding current coding projects I am working on as well as some CTF challenge writeups I’ll attempt in my spare time. I hope you enjoy reading this journey of mine.
